senior management

pros: Good salary, benefits, top management is nice. They value you in the long term and value employee happiness.
cons: Top management makes decisions and leaves out employees.

review_title: There’s been a culture shift lately...
pros: It’s a small hospital, so everyone knows everyone and it makes it easier to get things done for your patient. The patient care team really works together and advocates for the best of the patient. Some of the best respiratory therapists and CNA’s I’ve ever had the pleasure of working with.
cons: Pay and benefits are below market. Insurance is very expensive and not very good. 403b matching is poor. Raises are “merit based” but there is no consistency to how that is applied, and sadly, some managers seem to play favorites. I know of a nurse who had many years experience in several areas of healthcare, who got excellent performance reviews, and the lowest raises. A nurse with a year less experience, only at th hospital a year, made more due to raises. It’s very cliquey; people who have been there many years are “untouchable” and HR is a joke. A nurse was racially discriminated against by another nurse and HR refused to do anything, even allow the nurse to be moved to a different weekend rotation so she didn’t have to work in a hostile environment. There were multiple witnesses. The senior management likes to make decisions for the staff, not with the staff. No incentive to further your education or gain certifications.

pros: Great pay and benefits package
cons: Toxic environment with needless competition among employees

pros: great and easy job for busy high school students

job_title: Human Resources Recruiter in Milford, MA
pros: People care about each other and treat each very well.  Top management from CEO, President down are compassionate & caring and treat employees with respect.  I love my job (Recruiting) because I get to meet people from all professions.  Benefits are great and competitive and there is free parking!  Our nursing staff gives the best care ever.  Dana Farber and Brigham & Women's is across the street.  We have a new Sport Rehab Center - people there are awesome.
cons: I don't really have anything negative to say.  I love this hospital and am proud to be a part of the hospital system.  I respect our management and patient care is the best around.

pros: Good differentials ($4.75 nights, $3.75 eves, $2.75 weekends), great people & awesome teamwork.  Many opportunities to grow as a new nurse due to added responsibilities as a small hospital.
cons: Not always staffed safely, full assignment on top of being charge RN. 4-5 patients on days/eves, 6-7 patients on nights (excluding PCU/ICU). Management is poor and at times, staff is not listened to when it is expressed that there is an unsafe environment.  As long as beds are filled, management does not seem to care.

review_title: Pretty good but still room for improvement
pros: Pays well. Benefits aren't bad. Nice people to work with on the whole.
cons: Lack of help or support for furthering career goals or attaining new skills. Very specific tuition reimbursement policies that give it little use. Members of management who seem to have gotten there out of the "Peter Principle" and no means of working around them even when they're hampering the project/situation.

review_title: The workplace culture at MRMC is high in team morale and collective efficacy.
job_title: Patient Safety Assistant in Milford, MA
pros:
Shift differerential pay
Professional development
Flexible schedules
Alot of internal movement 
Cafeteria -  sometimes good
Invests in updating equipment and new technology
cons:
Parking can be stressful and make you late
Overtime is strongly stifled
Departments can sometimes become siloed
Not too much of a positive feedback loop

pros: It's a great little hospital overall. If you're just starting out in the medical field this is a good hospital to start from.
cons:
The hospital really lacks upholding policies. It depends on the management and because of this it can be really hard to assimilate. 
Also the training in the laboratory department has never been uniform. It's hard to learn when you have a different person everyday trying to teach you the same task but each one of the trainer's have a different ("or a my ways better") of doing those tasks..In the years I was there I had 4 phlebotomy supervisors and 4 different lab managers.

review_title: Remember its a business- thats how you will be treated
pros: Work life balance for the most part is reasonable
cons:
Very few raises if any, you can go several years without.. Make sure you negotiate a good salary when you interview, you may not see any increase for quite some time, They just want you to be grateful for having a job.
Management will not hesitate to weed you out of a job if you are the least bit out spoken in regards to Ethics. Even if you are extremely good at the job, been there several  years and everyone gets along great with you.

pros: I enjoy coming to work every day, and feel proud to be a part of such a top quality hospital and medical center. Senior Management cares about providing excellent patient care, and knows that good employees are a huge part of making that happen.  Nice work environment, friendly people, challenging work, good cafeteria food, free parking.  Hard work is acknowledged, and people take the time to say thank you.
cons: No complaints, but it would be nice to have an onsite gym.

pros: Began working there in 2008 and was happy for the first 5 years. Because of the new ER and associated cost overruns management cuts the average worker including nurses salaries to raise their own pay & bonuses. Was transferred to IS as cost cutting move and management is rude, name calling, calling worker's stupid, and the like. There is nothing positive to working there and they never made the Boston Globe's best place to work because moral is really bad.
cons: When management can harass their own class of exempt manager employees out of a ICU managers position, management is ruling the place like a communist party.

pros: Good benefits, some of the managers and directors are amazing.
cons: Of course it is necessary to bring in money to keep the hospital running, but there was a culture shift a few months before I left that switched from building a family-like atmosphere to building a profit and score based atmosphere. It was so disappointing.

pros: Great nurse manager to work with. Co-workers were great. Most of the physicians were good to work with.  One of the better community hospitals around.
cons: No raises for a few years and management could be clueless at times. Benefits were not great and not a lot of opportunity for additional hours for those working part time.

review_title: A Company who needs to get back to basics.
